header: Are you a non-Greek citizen who is transferred to Greece by a European state, which implements “Dublin III” Regulation and has regarded you a person seeking asylum?

title: You are eligible to seek asylum status or subsidiary protection status in Greece if you wish to do so.
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the questions above, you are eligible to seek asylum status or subsidiary protection status in Greece if you wish to do so.

title: Do not fall under any of the above categories but may face dangers in your home country or country of residence
header: If you personally do not fall under any of the above categories, are you facing dangers in your home country or country of residence, such as the death penalty, torture, or serious threat to your life due to general circumstances in the country or region you are from?

title: Would you wish to seek asylum status in Greece?
header: Would you wish to seek asylum status in Greece?

title: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory) 1/3
header: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory)
content:
Please approach a European Asylum Support Office (EASO) staff in the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) within 10 days following your arrival to express orally or in writing that you wish to seek asylum status in Greece.

European Asylum Support Office (EASO) will subsequently schedule full registration of your application, within which European Asylum Support Office (EASO) will fill out a registration form for international protection on your behalf. 

The registration form will include a number, which is your case number to submit an application for asylum.  From the time you receive your application number until your application is examined at the first instance and, in case, at the appellate stage, you cannot be forced to leave Greece (deportation).

title: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory) 2/3
header: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory)
content:
Access to the international protection (asylum) procedure system is free of charge.

You have the right to hire a lawyer for money or get one for free to assist you during the asylum process.

title: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory) 3/3
header: Submission of application for asylum (MORIA Territory)
content:
Please note if you identified yourself to fall under at least one of the vulnerable categories but the nurse or doctor who conducted your initial medical screening did not categorize you under a vulnerable category, you may request to undergo a vulnerability assessment.

If you want to undergo a vulnerability assessment, please approach a Greek Asylum Service or European Asylum Support Office (EASO) official to express your interest for such assessment to be conducted.

You may schedule either a physical or psychological assessment free of charge and will be transported to the medical facility where the assessment will be conducted.

During the physical or psychological assessment, the doctor conducting the assessment will determine whether you fall under at least one of the vulnerable categories.

title: Registration Interview Introduction
header: Registration Interview Introduction
content:
The competent authorities to register your application are the Regional Asylum Offices and the Regional Asylum Office dispatched units.  In Lesvos, the European Asylum Support Office (EASO) that aids the Greek Asylum Service with the asylum process conducts registrations.

The registration interview is typically conducted 1-3 weeks following your fill-out of the registration form with EASO but could take even three months depending on the workload of EASO and the Greek authorities.

title: Are you 18 years of age or older?
header: Are you 18 years of age or older?

title: Are you traveling with your family?
header: Are you traveling with your family?

title: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
header: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
content: On the day of your full registration, you and members of your family who are also in Greece with you must come in person to the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos (Nationality Identification Center, Moria, 811 00 Lesvos; Tel: (0030) 22510 32323; E-mail: pga.lesvou@asylo.gov.gr) to submit an application.

title: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
header: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
content:
In the event you are detained in the Detention Center of the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) (actual prison), you will be transferred inside the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) to be fully registered by an Asylum Unit.

As you enter the Regional Asylum Office where your registration will be conducted, you may be body searched and your personal belongings may too be searched for security reasons.

Please note it is strictly forbidden to carry into the premises of the Asylum Service weapons, explosive or flammable materials, chemical or toxic substances, sharp or other objects that may be used to induce injuries.

Only small personal belongings like briefcases and small handbags will be allowed to be carried into the premises of the Regional Asylum Office. 

Mobile phones are only allowed in the outdoor premises of the Regional Asylum Offices or the regional Asylum Office dispatched units.  Photographs or video recordings are prohibited within and outside the premises of the Regional Asylum Office.

title: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
header: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
content: The main purpose of the registration interview is to record your personal details as well as those of all members of your family traveling with you before the admissibility and eligibility interviews.  A secondary purpose of the registration interview is to identify and start processing family reunification cases in case you wish to be reunited with your family members, who already live in one of the Dublin III countries.  Your asylum claim will not be assessed during the registration interview.  Your asylum claim will be assessed during the admissibility and eligibility interviews.

title: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
header: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
content:
For children between 14 and 18, a shorter interview will be conducted.

Children under 14 will not be interviewed and their data will be conveyed by the parents to the official of the European Asylum Support Office (EASO) or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview.

title: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
header: You are 18 years of age and older with family or traveling alone registration process
content: During the registration interview, please declare your true name, your true nationality, your true age, and those of your family members traveling with you.  Please also make sure to use the exact spelling of your official name that is indicated in your identity card, passport, or birth certificate.  This is particularly important if your official name is transliterated to the Latin alphabet.

title: Are you 60 years of age or older?
header: Are you 60 years of age or older?

title: Are you a pregnant woman?
header: Are you a pregnant woman?

title: Vulnerable Person Registration Interview Introduction
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, you must insist on being registered as a vulnerable person.
content:
The official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview will ask for travel documents (passport) or any other document in your possession that is relevant to the examination of your application, the verification of you and your family members’ identity, country and place of origin, as well as family status.  Please bring any relevant documents with you for the registration interview.

Please note that the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview will ask for your passport, national ID, and other relevant documents for the examination of your asylum claim.  These documents will be handed back to you upon completion of your asylum application except for your passport, which will be confiscated and be handed back to you only upon completion of your asylum process.

title: Vulnerable Person Registration Interview Introduction
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, you must insist on being registered as a vulnerable person.
content:
An official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview will ask some basic questions around your asylum claim.  These questions could include why you do not want to go back to your country or the country where you lived before coming to Lesvos. 

Please make sure everything you say and all the documents you provided are true and complete.  False or incomplete information will delay your asylum application and may have negative consequences.  Fake information or false evidence will be very difficult to change later and might even cause rejection of the asylum claim.

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Do you have a valid or expired residence permit in any of these countries and did your expired residence permit expire not more than  two years ago?

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Do you have a valid or expired visa issued by any of these countries and did your expired visa expire not more than six months ago?

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Did you enter any of these countries illegally within the past 12 months?

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Did you stay illegally in any of these countries for five consecutive months before submitting your asylum application in Greece?

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Did you enter any of these countries legally before coming to Greece?

title: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Did you submit an asylum application in any of these countries before coming to Greece?

title: Greece Asylum is Rejected
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, Greece is not responsible for the examination of your asylum application.
content: The Dublin III country that is responsible for examining your asylum claim is not Greece.

title: Greece Asylum is Rejected
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, Greece is not responsible for the examination of your asylum application.
content:
Please provide the Greek Asylum Service or EASO official conducting your registration interview any evidence you may have that proves your residency, visa status, illegal or legal entry, or previous asylum application in the Dublin III country you previously indicated.

The Greek Asylum Service will examine your claims and evidence and determine whether Greece or any other Dublin III country is responsible for examining your asylum application. 

If the Greek Asylum Service determines that Greece is not responsible for the examination of your asylum application, they will communicate with the Asylum Service of this Dublin III country and will initiate your transfer to this country.

title: Greece Asylum is Rejected
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, Greece is not responsible for the examination of your asylum application.
content:
If the Greek Asylum Service determines that Greece is responsible for the examination of your asylum application, they will proceed with your case.

Please note, transfer to the country which will be in charge of examining your asylum application will be made within a few months following the date the Dublin III country agreed to examine your case.

Please note if another Dublin III country agreed to examine your asylum application, your asylum application in Greece will automatically be rejected and you will not be able to seek asylum status in Greece.

title: Greece Asylum is Rejected
header: Since you answered yes to at least one of the aforementioned questions, Greece is not responsible for the examination of your asylum application.
content:
You have the right to submit an appeal against the rejection of your asylum application in Greece before the Independent Appeals Authority.

The deadline to submit an appeal in front of the Independent Appeals Authority will be stated in the negative decision of the Greek Asylum Service.

In case you decide to appeal the decision of the Asylum Service, you must submit your appeal in writing to the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos.

buttons.text: Continue with Accept / Appeal Asylum Claim

title: Asylum Claim
header: Dublin III Countries Questions for Asylum
content: Did you submit an asylum application in any of these countries before coming to Greece?

buttons.text: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece
Appeal asylum claim rejection in Greece

title: Asylum claim rejection in Greece is accepted
header: Asylum claim rejection in Greece is accepted
content: Within a few weeks but maximum within six months following the date the Dublin III country agreed to examine your case, you will be transferred there.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
content: During the registration interview, you have the right to select the sex of the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office who will conduct the registration interview.  Please indicate if you do not feel comfortable answering the questions of the EASO or the Regional Asylum Office employee and you wish to change the interviewer.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
content: During the registration interview, you will also be asked to indicate the preferred sex of the officer conducting the admissibility and eligibility interviews as well as the sex of the interpreter assisting with the admissibility and eligibility interviews.  Your request will be assessed by EASO or the Regional Asylum Office and will be fulfilled if possible.  If EASO or the Regional Asylum Office is not able to provide you an officer of the desired sex, they must provide you reasons for such.  In such cases, EASO or the Regional Asylum Office may proceed without assigning you an officer of the preferred sex.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
content: In order to avoid any mistakes in your asylum file, at the end of the registration interview, please verify all information that you provided to the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office during the registration interview.  Mistakes in your asylum application may delay or create complications for your case.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview
content: A few hours following your registration interview, the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the interview should provide you with an international protection applicant’s card (commonly known as “ausweis”).  In exceptional circumstances, when there is a large influx of people, the processing time of the ausweis may be delayed.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Please note that the ausweis is the single most important document, as it has key information related to your asylum case and is your only form of identity in Greece.  You must carry the ausweis with you at all times and keep it in good condition.

If you fail to carry and present your ausweis upon request by the Greek authorities, you may be detained, and your asylum application may negatively be impacted.

In case you lose your ausweis, you must immediately inform EASO or the Regional Asylum Office in person and ask for a replacement.  Please note that the issuance of a new ausweis may take four to five months and may significantly delay your asylum application.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
The ausweis will state the date and location of your admissibility and eligibility interview.  This date and location are very important, as your asylum claim will be assessed on the date stated in your ausweis.

On the date stated on your ausweis you must appear at the location stated on your ausweis in front of the official of the Greek Asylum Service to conduct the admissibility and eligibility interview.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Please note, in certain cases, the date and location of your admissibility and eligibility interview stated on your ausweis may change depending on the availability of the Greek Asylum Service.  In such case, the updated date and location of your admissibility and eligibility interview will officially be communicated to you.

If you do not appear on the date stated on your ausweis or communicated to you officially, your asylum application will be delayed by months, as your case may be archived.  This is why it is very important to appear in front of the Greek Asylum Service on the date and time and at the location communicated to you.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: Every ausweis has an expiration date highlighted on it.  You are obliged to have a valid ausweis with you at all times.  You must go to the Asylum Service or EASO in person to renew your ausweis before the date stated on your ausweis.  If you fail to renew your ausweis, your case may be closed, and you may be forced to leave Greece (deportation).

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
image: assets/chapter3/images/ausweis legal case number, medical police number-01.png
content: The ausweis will also contain your legal case number and medical and police folder number.  Please note that one legal case number is issued for all members of the same family.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: If you answered yes to at least one of the questions under registration process and you are registered as a vulnerable person, the international code of the vulnerable group you qualify for is stated on your ausweis.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: Finally, the ausweis will contain your photo, full name, father and mother’s name, date and place of birth, nationality, residential address, and date of application.

title: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Accept asylum claim rejection in Greece - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: EASO or the Regional Asylum Office may place a red stamp at the bottom right corner of your ausweis.  This means a geographical restriction has been imposed on you until the date of expiry of your ausweis and you are not allowed to travel outside Lesvos beforehand.  Please note, upon renewal of your ausweis, if the red stamp stays on your renewed ausweis, the travel restriction still holds.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
Since you are considered to be a “vulnerable person,” you may leave Lesvos freely and legally once you obtain your ausweis.  You may travel and move to any part of Greece but you are obliged to stay within Greece.

Please note for your eligibility interviews you may have to return to Lesvos.  The date and location of your eligibility interviews will be stated on your ausweis or communicated to you following the receipt of your ausweis.

Please also note, as a vulnerable person, you will automatically pass the admissibility interview.  Therefore, no such interview will be scheduled for you.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
If you decide to travel outside Lesvos despite a geographical restriction imposed on you, this may severely harm your asylum application and may result in significant delays of your case due to archiving or, in the worst-case scenario, rejection of your asylum application.  This means you may be forced to leave Greece.

If your ausweis does not contain a red stamp, you may leave Lesvos and freely travel within Greece.  Please note you are obliged to stay within Greece.  If you decide to travel outside Greece, this may severely harm your asylum application and may result in rejection of your asylum claim and deportation.

Following the reception of your ausweis, you, as an applicant for international protection, automatically have the right to apply for employment in Greece and have the right to obtain a Tax ID and an AMKA (social security number).  As an employee, you have the same rights and obligations regarding social security as any Greek citizen.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: Please note, as an applicant for international protection, you have the right to receive hospital, medical, and pharmaceutical treatment free of charge even if you are uninsured.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: You, as well as your children and other family members, have access to the public educational system in Greece free of charge.  You also have access to vocational training in Greece free of charge.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
If you are homeless, you have the right to ask the Greek Asylum Service to host you in a Reception Center or other facility, provided that there is sufficient space for you.

If you are not able to be accommodated in a Reception Center or other similar facility and are a disabled person with a disability percentage of 67 percent and above, you have the right to receive a disability allowance of 313 euros per month and may also be eligible for unemployment benefits.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: Please note as an applicant for international protection, you are not allowed to transfer your family from your home country or country of previous residence to Greece.  You will only be allowed to do this if you receive asylum status following your eligibility interview.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: Please note if you are detained in the Detention Center of the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) (actual prison), you must be provided with your ausweis on the day of your release, in case the examination of your application is still pending.  You also need to present yourself to the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos within 10 days to state your home address and contact information and be provided with an ausweis, in case you have not received one already.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: At the end of your registration interview, the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the interview will inform you, in a language that you understand with the help of the interpreter, about the asylum procedure, your rights and obligations while being an international protection applicant.  S/he will also provide you deadlines that apply throughout the procedure.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
Your obligations include abiding by all deadlines determined by the Greek Asylum Service throughout the different stages of the asylum procedure.  Please note if you fail to abide by any deadline, your asylum application may significantly be delayed or even, in the worst-case scenario, rejected.

As an applicant for international protection in Greece, you must remain in Greece until the examination of your application is completed.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
If you leave Greece or your area of residence which was determined for you without informing the Greek authorities beforehand, the Asylum Service may consider that you are not interested in the continuation of your asylum application and may discontinue its examination.  If your asylum application is no longer examined, you will be forced to leave Greece.

You must cooperate with the Greek authorities regarding any issue related to your application and the verification of your personal data.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content: You must immediately inform the Greek Asylum Service or EASO of any changes in your residence or contact information.  This is particularly important as the Asylum Service or EASO may want to get in touch with you anytime to communicate any updates on your asylum application or ask for additional information.

title: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
header: Additional Disclaimer if Vulnerable Individual - Registration Interview
content:
While you wait for your admissibility and eligibility interviews, you must also comply with all regulations of the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) or any other facility where you are housed and you must follow the Greek law.

Following your registration, you may be put into contact with an NGO or any other organization that provides legal, medical, and/or psychological support.

Please note, you are eligible to receive a 90 euro per individual per month allowance from UNHCR if you reside in the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria), Olive Grove, or Kara Tepe following registration until you receive your second rejection on your appeal from the Independent Appeals Authority.  If you reside outside these facilities, you are eligible for an allowance of 150 euros per individual per month to compensate for food and any additional expenses you may incur by residing outside a camp.

title: Do you have a family member from one of the Dublin III countries?
header: Do you have a family member from one of the Dublin III countries?

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content: On the day of your full registration, you and your guardian must come in person to the Regional Office of the Asylum Service in Moria to submit an asylum application.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content:
If an Asylum Unit does not operate inside or near the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) where you are held, you will be transferred to the nearest Regional Asylum Office.

Please note as a minor, you cannot be detained in the Detention Center of the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) (actual prison).

As you enter the Regional Asylum Office or the regional Asylum Office dispatched unit where your registration will be conducted, please note you may be body searched and your personal belongings may too be searched for security reasons.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content:
Please note it is strictly forbidden to carry into the premises of the Greek Asylum Service weapons, explosive or flammable materials, chemical or toxic substances, sharp or other objects that may be used to induce injuries

Only small personal belongings like briefcases and small handbags will be allowed to be carried into the premises of the Regional Asylum Office. 

Mobile phones are only allowed in the outdoor premises of the Regional Asylum Office.  Photographs or video recordings are prohibited within and outside the premises of the Regional Asylum Office.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content:
The main purpose of the registration interview is to record your personal details before the eligibility interview.  Your asylum claim will not be assessed during the registration interview.  Your asylum claim will be assessed during the eligibility interview.

* If you are under 15 years of age, your application for international protection must be submitted by the appointed representative.

* If you are over 15 years of age, you may submit your application yourself. 

* For children between 14 and 18, a shorter registration interview will be conducted.

* Children under 14 will not be interviewed.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content:
During the registration interview, please declare your true name, your true nationality, your true age, and those of members of your family traveling with you.  Please also make sure to use the exact spelling of your official name that is indicated in your identity card, passport, or birth certificate.  This is particularly important if your official name is transliterated to the Latin alphabet.

You must insist on being registered as a vulnerable person.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content: The official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview will ask for travel documents (passport) or any other document in your possession that is relevant to the examination of your application, the verification of your identity, country and place of origin, as well as family status.  Please bring any relevant documents with you for the registration interview.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content: The official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview will take your passport, national ID, and other relevant documents for the assessment of your asylum claim.  The documents will be given back to you when your application is completed.

title: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
header: You are not 18 years of age or older and you are not traveling with your family registration process
content:
You will also be asked some basic questions around your asylum claim including the reasons why you do not wish to return to your country or origin or country of previous residence by the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the registration interview.

Please make sure to provide information around your personal information as well as basic facts around your asylum claim that is absolutely true and complete.  Fake or incomplete information will not only delay your asylum application but will have negative implications on it.  Fake information or false evidence will be very difficult to change as you proceed with the asylum application and could even cause rejection of the asylum claim.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: Following your registration interview, you will be asked to provide your fingerprints.  Your fingerprints will be entered into the European Dactyloscopy (Eurodac), the European Union’s fingerprint database for identifying asylum seekers.  This is to ascertain you have not submitted an application for international protection in any other Dublin III country.  The information will promptly be verified whether or not you have any other application pending.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
If a member of your family is legally present in a “Dublin III” country, following your registration of asylum application in Greece, the country where your family member resides is responsible for the examination of your application and you will be transferred there.

At the end of the registration interview, a photograph will be taken of you and all your family members above 14 separately.

The authorities may conduct medical tests to determine your age.  Both you and your representative must be informed regarding this procedure and you or your representative must consent. 

The registration will be conducted with the assistance of an interpreter in a language you understand.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: During the registration interview, you have the right to select the sex of the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office who will conduct the registration interview.  Please indicate if you do not feel comfortable answering the questions of the EASO or the Regional Asylum Office employee and you wish to change the interviewer.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: During the registration interview, you will also be asked to indicate the preferred sex of the officer conducting the eligibility interview as well as the sex of the interpreter assisting with the eligibility interview.  Your request will be assessed by EASO or the Regional Asylum Office and will be fulfilled if possible.  If EASO or the Regional Asylum Office is not able to provide you an officer of the desired sex, they must provide you reasons for such.  In such cases, EASO or the Regional Asylum Office may proceed without assigning you an officer of the preferred sex.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
In order to avoid any mistakes in your asylum file, at the end of the registration interview, please verify all information that you provided to the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office during the registration interview.  Mistakes in your asylum application may delay or create complications for your case.

A few hours following your registration interview, the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the interview will hand your representative an international protection applicant’s card (commonly known as “ausweis”.)

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Please note that the ausweis is the single most important document, as it has key information related to your asylum case and is your only form of identity in Greece.  

Your ausweis will be kept with your guardian at a safe location and s/he must be able to present it to the Greek authorities upon request.

In case you lose or damage your ausweis, your guardian must immediately inform EASO or the Regional Asylum Office and ask for a replacement.  Please note issuance of a new ausweis may take four-five months that may significantly delay your asylum application.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
The ausweis will state the date and location of your eligibility interview.  This date and location are very important, as your asylum claim will be assessed on the date stated in your ausweis.

On the date stated on your ausweis you and your guardian must appear at the location stated on your ausweis in front of the official of the Greek Asylum Service to conduct the eligibility interview.

It is the responsibility of your guardian to ensure you appear on the date stated on your ausweis.  If you do not appear on the specified date, your asylum application will be delayed by months, as your case may be archived.  This is why it is very important to appear in front of the Greek Asylum Service on the date and time and at the location communicated to you.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Every ausweis has an expiration date highlighted on it.  It is your guardian’s responsibility to ensure you have a valid ausweis at all times.  Your guardian must go to the Asylum Service or EASO in person to renew your ausweis before the date stated on your ausweis.  If your guardian fails to renew your ausweis, your case may be closed, and you may be forced to leave Greece (deportation); therefore, you must ensure that your guardian renews your ausweis in a timely manner.

The ausweis will also contain your legal case number and medical and police folder number.

As an unaccompanied minor, the international code of SC-UC will appear on your ausweis.

Finally, the ausweis will contain your photo, full name, father and mother’s name, date and place of birth, nationality, residential address, and date of application.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: Following the reception of your ausweis, if you are a minor under 15, you do neither have the right to apply for employment in Greece nor to obtain a Tax ID and an AMKA (social security number).

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: Following the reception of your ausweis, if you are minor of 15 years of age or above, you may seek the consent of your guardian to have the right to apply for employment in Greece or obtain a Tax ID and an AMKA (social security number).

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Please note, as an applicant for international protection, you have the right to receive hospital, medical, and pharmaceutical treatment free of charge even if you are uninsured.

You have full access to the public educational system as well as vocational training in Greece free of charge.

If you are not able to be accommodated in a Reception Center or other similar facility and are a disabled person with a disability percentage of 67 percent and above, you have the right to receive a disability allowance.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content: If you are not able to be accommodated in a Reception Center or other similar facility and are a disabled person with a disability percentage of 67 percent and above, you have the right to receive a disability allowance.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Please note, you will only be allowed to transfer your close family members from your home country or country of previous residence to Greece once you receive asylum status following your eligibility interview.

At the end of your registration interview, the official of EASO or the Regional Asylum Office conducting the interview will inform you and your guardian, in a language that you understand with the help of the interpreter, about the asylum procedure, your rights and obligations while being an international protection applicant.  S/he will also provide you deadlines that apply throughout the procedure.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
Your obligations include abiding by all deadlines determined by the Asylum Service throughout the different stages of the asylum procedure.  Please note if you fail to abide by any deadline, your asylum application may significantly be delayed or even, in the worst-case scenario, rejected.

As an applicant for international protection in Greece, you must remain in Greece until the examination of your application is completed.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
As an unaccompanied minor, you will be transported to a special facility maintained for unaccompanied minors until the examination of your application is completed or you reach 18 years of age.  Your ausweis will be kept with the facility that houses you.

If you leave the area of residence which was determined for you or Greece without informing the Greek authorities beforehand, your asylum application may severely be harmed and the Greek Asylum Service may consider that you are not interested in the continuation of your asylum application and may discontinue its examination.  If your asylum application is no longer examined, you will be forced to leave Greece.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
You must cooperate with the Greek authorities regarding any issue related to your application and the verification of your personal data.

You must immediately inform the Greek Asylum Service or EASO of any changes in your residence or contact information.  This is particularly important as the Asylum Service or EASO may want to get in touch with you anytime to communicate any updates on your asylum application or ask for additional information.

If you fail to provide information that was asked by the Asylum Service and this information is of great importance to your case or the Asylum Service is unable to contact you, the Asylum Service may consider that you are not interested in the continuation of your asylum application and may discontinue its examination.  If your asylum application is no longer examined, you will be forced to leave Greece.

title: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
header: Unaccompanied Minor - Registration Interview and Ausweis Process
content:
While you wait for your eligibility interview, you must comply with all regulations of the First Reception and Identification Center (Moria) or any other facility where you are housed, and you must abide by Greek law.

Your ausweis will be kept with your guardian in a secure location and s/he must be able to present it to the Greek authorities upon request.

Following your registration, your guardian may put you into contact with an NGO or any other organization that provides legal, medical, and psychological support.

Please note, you may be eligible to receive a small amount (5-10 euros per individual per month) of allowance from UNHCR following your registration until you receive a second rejection on your appeal from the Independent Appeals Authority.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content:
In order to submit an appeal to the Greek Asylum Service, you must have received a rejection of your asylum application.

Please note you must be notified by the Asylum Service of their rejection of your asylum application before you have the right to submit an appeal and ask the Greek Asylum Service to reconsider its decision.

Please note you must appear in person at the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos that notified you of the negative decision to submit an appeal.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content:
If you fail to appear in person in front of the Regional Asylum Office that notified you of the negative decision, you will not be allowed to file an appeal and will be forced to leave Greece.

Please note you must submit an appeal in writing by filling out a form of the Greek Asylum Service.

The Greek Asylum Service will provide you a date when your case will be examined by the Appeals Committee.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content:
You will have to find a lawyer or legally-trained professional, who speaks Greek and is allowed to practice law in Greece, to submit a memo that indicates well-founded reasons why you are appealing the previous negative decision of the Greek Asylum Service and why you think you should be granted asylum status.

The memo must be submitted at least two days before the examination of the appeal.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content:
If you wish to seek help from a Greek lawyer to submit your appeal, please indicate such a request to the Greek Asylum Service and they must assign you one free of charge.

If the Greek Asylum Service fails to assign you a lawyer or you are unable to find a lawyer free of charge, you may request rescheduling your appeal date through a form provided by the Greek Asylum Service until you have found a lawyer

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
image: assets/chapter5/images/uniformed personnel talking to person with calendar-01.png
content: If the lawyer who is helping you with your appeal case did not contact you or you are not satisfied with his/her services, you have the right to request rescheduling your appeal date and seek the services of a new lawyer.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content: The Independent Appeals Authority will examine your request for postponement of your appeal date on the same date that you submitted such request and they will decide whether to proceed with the examination of your appeal on the original date or postpone it to a new date.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content: Please make sure to include any new evidence and/or medical records that you have obtained or have been given since your admissibility and eligibility interviews as you submit your appeal.  Submission of any new evidence or medical records could be beneficial as you argue for an appeal of a previous negative decision.

title: Appeal Asylum Process
header: Appeal Asylum Process
content:
You have five calendar days to submit an appeal at the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos that notified you of the negative decision in writing.  The five-calendar-day-appeal-period starts on the next day after the date you were notified of the negative decision. Please note the appeal period is five calendar days as opposed to five business days, which means you may have less than five business days to submit an appeal.

If you fail to submit an appeal in five calendar days following your notification of the negative decision in front of the Regional Asylum Office that notified you of the negative decision, you will not be allowed to file an appeal and will be forced to leave Greece.

title: Vulnerable Person - Appeal Submission
header: Vulnerable Person - Appeal Submission
content: You have 30 calendar days to submit an appeal at the Regional Asylum Office or regional Asylum Office dispatched unit that notified you of the negative decision in writing.  The 30-calendar-day-appeal-period starts on the next day after the date you were notified of the negative decision.  Please note the appeal period is 30 calendar days as opposed to 30 business days, which means you will have less than 30 business days to submit an appeal.

title: Vulnerable Person - Appeal Submission
header: Vulnerable Person - Appeal Submission
image: assets/chapter5/images/person with bag w calendar 30 days-01.png
content: If you fail to submit an appeal in 30 calendar days following your notification of the negative decision in front of the Regional Asylum Office or regional Asylum Office dispatched unit that notified you of the negative decision, you will not be allowed to file an appeal and will be forced to leave Greece.

title: Do you wish to submit an appeal?
header: Do you wish to submit an appeal?

title: You are not eligible to seek asylum
header: You are not eligible to seek asylum

title: Seek help from IOM Process
header: Seek help from IOM Process
content:
You may either seek appeal or benefit from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program; hence, you may not choose both options.

If you select to appeal the decision of the Greek Asylum Service, you will not be able to benefit from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program.

title: Seek help from IOM Process
header: Seek help from IOM Process
content:
YYou may either seek appeal or benefit from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program; hence, you may not choose both options.

If you select to appeal the decision of the Greek Asylum Service, you will not be able to benefit from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program.

title: Seek help from IOM Process
header: Seek help from IOM Process
content:
Please note you also have 30 calendar days to benefit from Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration (AVRR) provided by the International Organization for Migration (IOM) if you decide not to seek appeal of the negative decision of the Greek Asylum Service.

Please note if you have benefited before from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program, you will not be able to do so for the second time.

title: Seek help from IOM Process
header: Seek help from IOM Process
content:
Since you have 30 calendar days following notification by the Greek Asylum Service on the negative decision of your asylum claim, if you are interested in benefiting from IOM’s Assisted Voluntary Return and Reintegration program, you must indicate such interest as soon as possible by contacting IOM’s representative.

Please contact an employee of the International Organization for Migration (IOM) at hq@iom.int or info@iom.int or +41.22.717 9111 or +41.22.798 6150 to see if there is a program to voluntary return to your country of origin or country of previous residence.  If there is such program, IOM officials will assist you with your return to your country of origin or country of previous residence.  You may find further information on IOM through their website: https://www.iom.int/.

title: Proceed with Submission of an Appeal
header: Proceed with Submission of an Appeal
content:
Examination of an appeal may take from one week to several months following your submission of an appeal depending on the workload of the Greek Asylum Service and the nature of your case.

You will be notified by the Regional Asylum Office of the date when your appeal will be examined.

title: Proceed with Submission of an Appeal
header: Proceed with Submission of an Appeal
image: assets/chapter5/images/person w sad face for deportation-01.png
content:
Please note the Independent Appeals Authority will not decide on your case on the day that your appeal is examined. 

Please note you may decide to withdraw your appeal anytime while awaiting the date when the examination of your appeal is scheduled.  This however means, upon withdrawal of your appeal, you will not be able to obtain asylum status and will be forced to leave Greece immediately.

title: Do you wish to withdraw your appeal?
header: Do you wish to withdraw your appeal?

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
image: assets/chapter5/images/person talking to uniformed personnel athens-01.png
content: Please note your appeal will be examined by an Independent Appeals Authority based in Athens and not by the Regional Asylum Offices in Lesvos or any other Regional Asylum Office or regional Asylum Office dispatched units.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content: The Independent Appeals Authority typically consists of two Administrative Appeals Court Justices and an UNHCR lawyer who review an applicant’s evidence from the registration, admissibility, and eligibility interviews as well as any other materials previously submitted to the Greek Asylum Service and contained in the applicant’s asylum file.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content:
Please note the Independent Appeals Authority typically does not conduct an actual hearing of the applicant.

As you file your appeal at the Regional Asylum Office, you have the right to request that you want to be present during the examination of your asylum file by the Independent Appeals Authority.  This decision, however, entirely rests with the Independent Appeals Authority and they may decide that you will not be allowed to be present during the examination.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content:
In case the Independent Appeals Authority decides to call you for a hearing, you will be notified at least one working day before the date of the hearing.

Please note even if you do not present yourself before the Independent Appeals Authority, the examination of your appeal will proceed.  It is, however, highly recommended to appear in front of the Committee if they ask you to do so to support your case and obtain a more beneficial outcome for yourself.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content:
You have the right to present yourself to the Independent Appeals Authority accompanied by a lawyer or other counselor, but it is not mandatory to have one as you appear in front of the Committee.

It is highly recommended to have a lawyer with you though, who is allowed to practice and represent you in Greece, as you appear in front of the Independent Appeals Authority to support your claims and assist you answering questions of the Committee.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
image: assets/chapter5/images/evidence w pictures of storm and disabled-01.png
content: You also have the right to submit additional evidence for the Independent Appeals Authority up to two days before your appeal is examined.  The Committee will take these evidence into consideration to make its decision accordingly if they are submitted in time.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content: If you have not been able to obtain an evidence you feel is crucial for your appeal, if you have been unable to secure a lawyer to be present with you during the appeal hearing, or if you have any other well-grounded reason, you may request a postponement of the examination of your appeal up to two days before your appeal is examined.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content: The Independent Appeals Authority’s decision to grant you refugee status, subsidiary protection status, humanitarian status, or reject your appeal may be made from a few days to several months after the examination of your appeal on the basis of all evidence and the answers provided in case a hearing takes place.

title: Continue with Appeal Process
header: Continue with Appeal Process
content: Please note you may decide to withdraw your appeal anytime while you are awaiting a decision of the Independent Appeals Authority.  This, however, means, upon withdrawal of your appeal, you will not be able to obtain asylum and will be forced to leave Greece immediately.

title: Do you wish to withdraw your appeal?
header: Do you wish to withdraw your appeal?

title: How do you want to leave Greece?
header: How do you want to leave Greece?

title: Awaiting Appeal Results
header: Awaiting Appeal Results
content: While you are awaiting the Independent Appeals Authority’s decision, you may provide new, substantial evidence to the Greek Asylum Service that you previously did not provide.  The Asylum Service will forward this evidence to the Independent Appeals Authority for their examination and take them into consideration as they make their decision on your asylum application.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results
header: Awaiting Appeal Results
content: Between a week and several months following the examination of your appeal, the Independent Appeals Authority will decide whether to grant you asylum status, subsidiary protection status, refer your case for humanitarian status, or reject your application.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results
header: Awaiting Appeal Results
image: assets/chapter5/images/uniformed personnel w thought bubble calling-01.png
content:
The Asylum Service will contact you regarding the Independent Appeals Authority’s decision on your asylum application through the contact information you provided them during the registration, admissibility and eligibility interviews.  You may be contacted via telephone, letter, e-mail, fax, or in person, as you renew your ausweis.

Please note the Asylum Service will notify you of the decision in your mother tongue or previously indicated preferred language in writing or orally with the assistance of an interpreter.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results
header: Awaiting Appeal Results
content:
If you obtain asylum status, you may receive a residence permit in Greece for three years.  You will be able to live and work in the country and your family can also join you immediately.

You may also extend your residence permit in Greece beyond three years online through the website of the Hellenic Ministry of Migration Policy or you may seek naturalization after three years of legal residency in Greece if you meet certain financial sustainability and language criteria.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results
header: Awaiting Appeal Results
content:
Subsidiary protection does not entail the same rights as asylum protection status.

If you obtain subsidiary protection, you may receive a residence permit in Greece for three year.  You will be able to live and work in Greece for three years.  Your family will however not be able to join you immediately.  Your family members may only be able to join you following a few years if you still have subsidiary protection status at that point.

title: Which are you interested in learning more about?
header: Which are you interested in learning more about?

title: Learn More About: Subsidiary Protection Status
header: Learn More About: Subsidiary Protection Status
content:
If the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority is to grant you subsidiary protection status, you will receive a residence permit in Greece. 

Please note subsidiary protection does not entail the same rights as asylum protection status.  Accordingly, the residence permit you are granted under subsidiary protection status will be valid for three years and your family members will not be able to join you immediately.

You may seek extension of your subsidiary protection status following its expiry.

title: Learn More About: Subsidiary Protection Status
header: Learn More About: Subsidiary Protection Status
content:
Under subsidiary protection status, you will be allowed to live and work in Greece.

Your family members may only be able to join you in Greece following a few years if you still have subsidiary protection status at that point.

If you received subsidiary protection status but you wish to obtain asylum status, you may appeal the decision of the Greek Asylum Service.

title: Do you wish to accept the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority?
header: Do you wish to accept the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority?

title: Appeal Subsidiary Protection Status
header: Appeal Subsidiary Protection Status
content:
In order to submit an appeal to the Greek Asylum Service against a decision that granted you subsidiary protection, you must have been granted subsidiary protection status while you were seeking asylum status.

Please note you must be notified by the Asylum Service of the issuance of subsidiary protection status for you before you have the right to submit an appeal and ask the Greek Asylum Service to reconsider its decision.

title: Appeal Subsidiary Protection Status
header: Appeal Subsidiary Protection Status
content:
Please note you must appear in person at the Regional Asylum Office in Lesvos that notified you of the negative decision to submit an appeal.

If you fail to appear in person in front of the Regional Asylum Office that notified you of the negative decision, you will not be allowed to file an appeal and will remain on subsidiary protection status.

Please note you must submit an appeal in writing by filling out a form of the Greek Asylum Service.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results (Subsidiary Protection Status)
header: Awaiting Appeal Results (Subsidiary Protection Status)

content:
The Asylum Service will contact you regarding the Independent Appeals Authority’s decision on your asylum application through the contact information you provided them during the registration, admissibility and eligibility interviews.  You may be contacted via telephone, letter, e-mail, fax, or in person, as you renew your ausweis.

title: Awaiting Appeal Results (Subsidiary Protection Status)
header: Awaiting Appeal Results (Subsidiary Protection Status)
content:
If you obtain asylum status, you may receive a residence permit in Greece for three years.  You will be able to live and work in Greece where you were granted asylum status and your family can also join you immediately.

You may also extend your residence permit in Greece if you meet certain language and financial sustainability criteria.

title: Which are you interested in learning more about?
header: Which are you interested in learning more about?

title: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
header: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
content:
If the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority is to grant you asylum status, you will be recognized as a refugee.

You may apply for a residence card and travel document (passport) in Greece where you were granted asylum status.

title: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
header: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
image: assets/chapter5/images/person w home and greece flag-01.png
content:
Your residence permit in Greece will be valid for three years and you may seek extension of it online through the website of the Hellenic Ministry of Migration Policy or you may seek naturalization after three years of legal residency in Greece if you meet certain financial sustainability and language criteria.

You will be allowed to live and work in Greece.

title: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
header: Learn More About: Asylum Status (Appeal)
content:
With the travel document you were granted, you may freely travel out of Greece.  You must however stay in Greece for at least three months in every six month-long period. (For example, you may leave Greece for three months between January and June).

Your family members may also live and work with you in Greece.

title: Learn More About: Rejection of Asylum Application (Appeal of Subsidiary Protection Status)
header: Learn More About: Rejection of Asylum Application (Appeal of Subsidiary Protection Status)
content:
If your asylum application has been rejected by the Independent Appeals Authority, you may either accept their decision or appeal against it to obtain asylum status.

If you decide to accept a rejection of your asylum application, you will remain on subsidiary protection status.

title: Do you wish to appeal the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority?
header: Do you wish to appeal the decision of the Independent Appeals Authority?
